channel.title: [Added] Minor v2.03 schema refactor, plus namespace bugfix
channel.description:
A [pull request was sent/received](https://github.com/IATI/IATI-Schemas/pull/426) that makes changes to the version 2.03 schema. @IATI-techteam [suggested](https://github.com/IATI/IATI-Schemas/pull/426#issuecomment-489103690) raising it with the community before they reach a decision, so that’s what I’m doing here.
The [pull request in question](https://github.com/IATI/IATI-Schemas/pull/426) DRYs up the schema a bit, to move some currency-related code out of the activity and organisation schemas and into the common schema (used by both). This is consistent with other refactoring changes made at v2.03.
It also fixes a minor bug related to custom namespaces. Java programmers may have run into this problem, since [xjc](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/tools/unix/xjc.html) gets stuck as a result of this bug (`Unique Particle Attribution error`).
If anyone objects to (or supports!) changing the v2.03 schema in this way, speak now! Thanks

item.title: [Added] Minor v2.03 schema refactor, plus namespace bugfix
item.dc:creator: samuele-mattiuzzo
item.description:
The changes have been checked on our end as well and we have merged them in the version-2.03 branch today since there has been no further activity on this thread.

Read full topic

A pull request was sent/received that makes changes to the version 2.03 schema. @IATI-techteam suggested raising it with the community before they reach a decision, so that’s what I’m doing here.

The pull request in question DRYs up the schema a bit, to move some currency-related code out of the activity and organisation schemas and into the common schema (used by both). This is consistent with other refactoring changes made at v2.03.

It also fixes a minor bug related to custom namespaces. Java programmers may have run into this problem, since xjc gets stuck as a result of this bug (Unique Particle Attribution error).

If anyone objects to (or supports!) changing the v2.03 schema in this way, speak now! Thanks
